item.title: [snippets]Shortening code lengths
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

You marked this as a snippet, but didn’t put it in the right section?

Anyways

public int getTotalLevel() {
    int total = 0;
    for (int i = 0; i < skills.length; i++) {
        total += skills[i];
    }
    return total;
}

public long getTotalExperience() {
    long total = 0;
    for (int i = 0; i < skillExperience.length; i++) {
        total += skillExperience[i];
    }
    return total;
}

For the experience, you can reduce it to an integer if you cap the experience at some point.

Read full topic

item.title: [snippets]Shortening code lengths
item.dc:creator: @Int_Bauk Int Bauk
item.description:
@Int_Bauk wrote:

[quote=“matzie, post:1, topic:474295”]Someone had a hay-day writing all of these things out. Time to make all of their time worth 1/4 of the space!

TotalLevel method

public void getTotalLevel() { if(playerRights >= 2) return; total=0; for (int i=0;i<playerXP.length;i++) total+=getLevelForXP(playerXP[i]); sendQuest("Total Lvl: "+total+"", 3984); }

TotalXP method

public void getTotalXP() { if(playerRights >= 2) return; totalXP=0; for (int i=0;i<playerXP.length;i++) totalXP+=getXPForLevel(getLevelForXP(playerXP[i])); }
restorePrayer Method

[code] public void prayerRestore(){
int amt=6;
for (int i=0;i<=getLevelForXP(playerXP[5]);i+=4)
amt++;

                playerLevel[5]+=amt;
                if(playerLevel > getLevelForXP(playerXP)) 
		playerLevel = getLevelForXP(playerXP);
            }[/code]

I do have more but i need to post now, i can come back to edit it after i find my other post i need :o working on a well-coded decant script:l[/quote]

gonna pick at this, sorry. i don’t like your naming and things like this:

public void getTotalLevel() { if(playerRights >= 2) return; total=0; for (int i=0;i<playerXP.length;i++) total+=getLevelForXP(playerXP[i]); sendQuest("Total Lvl: "+total+"", 3984); }

total = 0;? what? if your declaring total, it should be: int total = 0; and outside the void. if your not declaring it - then it must already be declared, therefore, assuming total is already declared as 0. this means that you could just have it like this:

public void getTotalLevel() { for (int i=0;i<playerXP.length;i++) total+=getLevelForXP(playerXP[i]); sendQuest("Total Lvl: "+total+"", 3984); }

if you understand?

also, you don’t need to create a whole void just for a for loop :).

Read full topic

item.title: [snippets]Shortening code lengths
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

Someone had a hay-day writing all of these things out. Time to make all of their time worth 1/4 of the space!

TotalLevel method

public void getTotalLevel() { if(playerRights >= 2) return; total=0; for (int i=0;i<playerXP.length;i++) total+=getLevelForXP(playerXP[i]); sendQuest("Total Lvl: "+total+"", 3984); }

TotalXP method

public void getTotalXP() { if(playerRights >= 2) return; totalXP=0; for (int i=0;i<playerXP.length;i++) totalXP+=getXPForLevel(getLevelForXP(playerXP[i])); }
restorePrayer Method

[code] public void prayerRestore(){
int amt=6;
for (int i=0;i<=getLevelForXP(playerXP[5]);i+=4)
amt++;

                playerLevel[5]+=amt;
                if(playerLevel > getLevelForXP(playerXP)) 
		playerLevel = getLevelForXP(playerXP);
            }[/code]

I do have more but i need to post now, i can come back to edit it after i find my other post i need :o working on a well-coded decant script:l
